abilitygroupdescription.p: Represents those abilities used to live in the wilderness: hunting, tracking, wayfinding, survivalism and woodcraft.

abilitydescription.p: Skills used for living under the ground: detect slope, detect depth, find direction.
This ability involves finding and hunting animals with a bow or spear.
Scout is the ability to notice things that are out of place in the wilderness. The character becomes aware of any subtle but strange changes in the environment.

Detect Trapssee Scout (Wilderness) Trapssee Scout (Wilderness) Scout can be used to detect traps, snares, lures etc in the wilderness. In urban environments use the Notice ability, and use a Perception Check in other cases.

Stealth ia the ability to move silently, avoiding detection, while not leaving a trace of the characters passage in the wilderness. This ability is used to avoid being tracked. Stealth can also be used for evading pursuit in the wilderness.
In urban or built environments use the Sneak ability, and use an Agility Check in other cases.

Constructing make-shift shelters, starting fires in challenging conditions, finding water, trapping and the use of snares. Normally this is not an issue for characters. However, when the cold north winds start to howl and the snow falls, when food runs low, or when alone in the burning deserts survival becomes difficult and someone should test against this ability. Trapscreate Survivalism (Wilderness)

Tracking is the art of following trails left by others. It applies mainly to the wilderness but given the right circumstances may be used in cities or beneath the earths surface. Tracking involves observing changes in the environment caused by the individuals being tracked. For example, it might be impossible to track someone who had moved down a corridor unless they had just walked through mud or water, or were wounded and leaving a trail of blood.

Wayfinding is the art of finding paths through the wilderness to a destination. Along major roads no check is required. Along tracks and side paths this should be a fairly straight-forward test. When walking through deep forest or jungle or foggy marshes this should be a hard test. Possession of a map or being in view of landmarks should also make the test much easier.

This ability represents knowledge of a particular biome. The (Type) will be a tag that is a rather broad geographical region. The GM determines available wilderness types but some suggested regions are The Frozen Barrens, The Blasted Deserts, The Four Seas, and the Lands of Civilized Men. There should not be too many.
